intro: Dalechampia senegalensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with thick, fleshy stems and lobed leaves. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
